cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the north-western Caribbean, forecast to cross western Cuba, enter the central Gulf of Mexico, and then bend north-westward toward the north-west Gulf Coast (LA/TX border) late in the work-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (roughly between Lake Charles and New Orleans)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and Artemisa, Isle of Youth, and the province of La Habana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cayman Islands including Little Cayman and Cayman Brac
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-west Caribbean, western Cuba, and the Gulf Coast from Texas through the Florida Panhandle are all within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 kt) possible late Thursday into Friday if the track shifts slightly west
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft inundation above ground in Sabine Pass and lower Sabine/Neches estuary if the center landfalls to the east
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands could bring 3–6 inches of rain to the Port Arthur area Friday–Saturday with locally higher totals
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls and isolated tornadoes embedded in outer rainbands could disrupt port operations.
